author: Team Latestly
title: Good Friday 2024 Messages and Bible Verses: Share Quotes, Sayings, Wallpapers and HD Images With Your Loved Ones During Holy Week | üôèüèª LatestLY
text: For Christians all around the world, Holy Week is one of the most important observances. This year, Holy Week is being observed from March 24‚Äì31. It begins with Palm Sunday and ends with Resurrection Sunday, or Easter, marking Jesus‚Äô resurrection after he was crucified on the cross. The sixth day of Holy Week, Good Friday, is the reason why Christians observe Holy Week. Good Friday, also known as Holy Friday or Great Friday, is the day when Jesus suffered and died on the cross to pay for humanity‚Äôs sins. Good Friday is a day of reflection, and sadness for Christians. This year, Good Friday will be observed on March 29, 2024. On this day, Christians around the world attend church services, fast, and mourn Jesus‚Äô death. Even though the observance is named Good Friday, the word good refers to holy or pious. Good Friday is not a celebration. To observe this special day with your loved ones, send them Good Friday 2024 quotes, sayings, Bible verses, HD images, and wallpapers using Facebook or WhatsApp. Good Friday 2024: Know the Date, History, and Significance of the Sixth Day of Holy Week, Also Known As Holy Friday or Great Friday. author: √Å. Espejo
title: Los sindicatos proponen movilizaciones por el bloqueo del convenio de la Vid en el Marco de Jerez
text:
Los sindicatos proponen movilizaciones por el bloqueo del convenio de la Vid en el Marco de Jerez
Los trabajadores de las bodegas votar√°n el 8 de abril en asamblea la propuesta sindical, que no descarta la convocatoria de huelga general despu√©s de Semana Santa
El vino de Jerez mira a Jap√≥n y M√©xico como alternativa a los aranceles de Trump
Jerez/Los trabajadores de las bodegas del Marco de Jerez decidir√°n el pr√≥ximo 8 de abril en asamblea si emprenden movilizaciones ante el bloqueo de la negociaci√≥n del convenio de la Vid. A los sindicatos se les ha agotado la paciencia sin que la patronal bodeguera Fedejerez haya dado se√±ales de querer reanudar los contactos, paralizados desde hace cinco meses.
Ante el enfriamiento de la negociaci√≥n tras m√°s de un a√±o sin avances -el convenio expir√≥ el 31 de diciembre de 2023-, CCOO y UGT someter√°n a votaci√≥n de los trabajadores una propuesta de inicio de movilizaciones a corto plazo, sin descartar la posibilidad de una huelga general.
En concreto, CCOO contempla desde concentraciones a paros totales, que comenzar√≠an despu√©s de Semana Santa, como medida de presi√≥n tras el rechazo de la patronal a las dos √∫ltimas propuestas de reuni√≥n realizadas por la comisi√≥n negociadora para retomar la mesa de di√°logo.
‚ÄúBasta ya, que no nos enga√±en‚Äù, reza en una circular remitida recientemente por CCOO a sus delegados en el sector de la Vid, que aglutina a unos 1.100 trabajadores fijos, pero del que dependen m√°s de 6.000 si se incluyen fijos-discontinuos, temporales y personal de subcontratas.
El sindicato mayoritario recordaba en su escrito los puntos calientes de la negociaci√≥n sobre los que las partes mantienen posiciones muy distantes que impiden alcanzar un acuerdo y que han provocado el enfriamiento de la negociaci√≥n, entre ellos la revisi√≥n salarial, sobre la que Fedejerez mantiene una propuesta ‚Äúrid√≠cula‚Äù, muy alejada del V Acuerdo para el Empleo y la Negociaci√≥n Colectiva (AENC) suscrito por los sindicatos y las patronales a nivel nacional, y que ‚Äúdijeron que iban a respetar‚Äù, explica Manuel Romero, responsable de CCOO Industria en el sector de la Vid.
Los sindicatos reclaman un suelo de subida del 3% para cada uno de los dos primeros a√±os del convenio (2024 y 2025), como establece el AENC, con una cl√°usula de garant√≠a salarial, mientras que para el tercer a√±o de vigencia (2026) proponen aplicar el IPC del a√±o anterior o cualquier f√≥rmula que evite la p√©rdida de poder adquisitivo.
La √∫ltima propuesta de la patronal bodeguera, que rechaz√≥ extender el convenio a cuatro a√±os (hasta 2027) como pretend√≠an los sindicatos ante la actual incertidumbre econ√≥mica, contempla por el contrario un incremento salarial del 1,5% tanto para 2024 como para 2025, reduci√©ndola al 1% para 2026. La subida, adem√°s, se sujeta a la eliminaci√≥n de la paga del 1% y al mantenimiento de la antig√ºedad congelada.
La plataforma sindical est√° dispuesta a negociar la flexibilidad, pero se oponen frontalmente a que sea ‚Äúmoneda de cambio‚Äù en el convenio, por lo que rechazan de plano que sea gratuita. ‚ÄúPodemos entender que ocasionalmente las empresas puedan necesitar de cierta flexibilidad para trabajar fuera del horario habitual, en s√°bados, domingos o festivos, aunque esto no debe ser la norma ni tampoco ha de servir para incrementar la jornada anual, menos ahora cuando se pretende reducir la misma‚Äù, se√±ala CCOO en su circular, en la que aboga por que est√© siempre justificada, sea de car√°cter voluntario, implica un descanso compensatorio y una retribuci√≥n digna.
Fedejerez apuesta, sin embargo, por que ‚Äúla voluntariedad sea para decidir si abona horas extraordinarias o un complemento de 40-50 euros por esos d√≠as, y disfrutar el descanso semanal en otro d√≠a laboral fuera del periodo de alta producci√≥n‚Äù.
Los contratos fijos-discontinuos y las licencias son los otros dos puntos en los que no hay acercamiento entre las partes. En el primero de los casos, CCOO recuerda que, al hilo de la √∫ltima reforma laboral, los sindicatos abogan por la introducci√≥n de la figura del fijo-discontinuo con el establecimiento de criterios objetivos y formales para su llamamiento, no as√≠ elementos subjetivos ‚Äúcomo la evaluaci√≥n del desempe√±o que plantea Fedejerez‚Äù. La patronal pretende adem√°s prevalezcan los acuerdos internos ya firmados sobre esta materia en las bodegas, para regular s√≥lo en aquellas en las que no est√© contemplada esta figura.
En cuanto a las licencias, los sindicatos defienden la adaptaci√≥n del convenio a ‚Äútodas‚Äù las mejoras previstas en el Real Decreto sin renunciar a las de fallecimiento, hospitalizaci√≥n, accidente, permiso retribuido de hasta ocho d√≠as por acompa√±amiento de un familiar al m√©dico fuera de la localidad o incluso el d√≠a de asuntos propios ‚Äúque tanto nos costaron conquistar‚Äù, todas ellas ‚Äúcuestionadas por la patronal en esta negociaci√≥n‚Äù.

author: Hannah Borchert
title: NCHC doctor sees uptick in patients experiencing psychosis after using THC and synthetic products
text: NCHC doctor sees uptick in patients experiencing psychosis after using THC and synthetic products WAUSAU, Wis. (WSAW) - Marathon County is researching a potential THC ordinance. While there are no immediate plans to present an ordinance proposal to the county board, doctors are speaking out about an alarming trend due to THC and synthetic products. One North Central Health Care doctor said he‚Äôs seen an uptick in patients experiencing psychosis. Often after taking THC and synthetic marijuana. The Wausau Fire Chief said it‚Äôs sometimes a mix of drugs or people just simply don‚Äôt know what they‚Äôre taking. ‚ÄúTrying to figure it out on the fly is a very challenging task,‚Äù said Wausau Fire Chief Jeremy Kopp. Figuring out what drugs a person took is crucial information in how to treat them. But first responders are often left guessing. ‚ÄúWhat we‚Äôre finding a lot of time is your younger folks that are experimenting for the first time and thinking they are doing one thing and not fully understanding what they are all doing and what‚Äôs all mixed in with what they may be trying,‚Äù said Fire Chief Kopp. Checking for vital signs and symptoms. Kopp said the presentation of a patient can always be different in how they handle things, whether it‚Äôs hallucinations or loss of consciousness. The Wausau Fire Department administered Narcan to 40 patients in 2023 and so far this year 17. That‚Äôs consistent with what some doctors are seeing. ‚ÄúIncidents have gone up over the last two years,‚Äù said Dr. Waqas Yasin, Psychiatrist at North Central Health Care. Meaning he‚Äôs seeing more frequent cases of psychosis after taking THC or synthetic products. ‚ÄúEspecially in patients who are younger associated with this synthetic cannabinoid,‚Äù said Dr. Yasin. He says the majority of the patients experiencing this are between 15 and 25. ‚ÄúThey start hearing things that aren‚Äôt there and then they start responding,‚Äù said Dr. Yasin. Dr. Yasin works in the inpatient psychiatric unit at North Central Health Care and he sees some of the most severe patients. ‚ÄúSometimes it takes up to weeks and months for them to get back to baseline,‚Äù said Dr. Yasin. In other cases, it can look more subtle like impacting the ability to function in school, jobs, and family environment. Dr. Yasin said it makes it difficult to think or solve problems. He said how it impacts young minds is complicated, just like the chemical makeup of the products. Delta 8,9,10 are the psychoactive component in cannabis. Delta 9 is what is naturally in the cannabis plant. Delta 8 and 10 are altered in a lab to change the chemical makeup. Their lab-created versions still qualify as federally legal ‚Äúhemp‚Äù under the 2018 Farm Bill so long as the starting point for the process was a hemp plant. That same bill defined hemp as a plant having less than 0.3% of Delta 9 THC and since it focuses specifically on Delta 9, Delta 8 and 10 are a gray area. There is also synthetic marijuana, often known as K2 or ‚ÄòSpice,‚Äô which is illegal. With all these variations with different chemical makeups, it‚Äôs hard to know what you‚Äôre taking. ‚ÄúThe package looks like and says one thing but what‚Äôs actually in the product is a whole another game,‚Äù said Chief Kopp. The FDA doesn‚Äôt regulate them. Dr. Yasin said they all can have a powerful impact on the brain. ‚Äú[They] bind to receptors in the brain which alters the chemicals which affect our emotions, our sense of reality and reasoning,‚Äù said Dr. Yasin. Causing people to act out of their character and worry loved ones. ‚ÄúAlthough they are being sold and they are being marketed as they don‚Äôt have side effects and they are okay to use, that‚Äôs absolutely wrong,‚Äù said Dr. Yasin. ‚ÄúWe want to get out there and we want to educate people and we want to be more proactive in dealing with it,‚Äù said Chief Kopp. Copyright 2024 WSAW. All rights reserved.
